format: A data frame with 51 observations on the following 8 variables.
reference:
The data are from Statistical Abstract of the United States and most variables were measured in 1993. These data should
result in regressions that would flunk a Breusch-Pagan test for heteroskedasticity.
description:
Description
These data are in Table 9.1 of the 3rd edition of Agresti and Finlay's
Statistical Methods for the Social Sciences. The data are from
Statistical Abstract of the United States and most variables were measured in 1993.
title: Statewide Crime Data (1993)

parameters.violent: a numeric vector for the violent crime rate (per 100,000 people in population)
parameters.highschool: a numeric vector for the percent of state that graduated from high school
parameters.metro: a numeric vector for the percent of population in metropolitan areas
parameters.murder: a numeric vector for the murder rate (per 100,000 people in population)
parameters.white: a numeric vector for the percentage of the state that is white
parameters.state: a character vector for the state
parameters.poverty: a numeric vector for the  percent with income below the poverty level
parameters.single: a numeric vector for the percent of families headed by a single parent
